patterns: What is the fee structure?
Tell me about the fee structure at FAST.

Can I get a breakdown of all fees?
When do I receive the fee invoice?
responses: The tuition fee at FAST is  Rs.11,000 per credit hour  for all campuses and programs (effective Fall 2025 semester). The fee is charged on a semester basis and becomes due two weeks before the start of a semester, typically at the time of course registration. An admission fee (Rs. 30,000) and a refundable security deposit (Rs. 20,000) are also payable at the time of admission.

patterns: What is the fee mode of payment?

What are the instructions for fee payment?
responses: Fees are paid in the bank through a bank challan available in the Accounts Office or on the Flex portal. You can also pay via bank account using the Kuickpay payment gateway (available through internet banking, mobile banking, or ATM), which supports various banks and mobile wallets like EasyPaisa and JazzCash.

responses: The admission fee is non refundable. The security deposit is refundable at the time of degree completion or closing of admission. Tuition fee refunds are processed according to HEC guidelines. As per recent guidelines (effective from December 20, 2024), you may receive a 100% refund up to the 10th day of classes, 80% up to the 15th day, 60% up to the 20th day, 50% up to the 30th day, and no refund thereafter.

patterns: Does FAST offer financial help?

Is there a fund to help students with expenses?
Do they have a program for low income students?

Are there ways to ease the financial burden of studying?
Tell me about the financial help for students.
responses: FAST, being a non profit organization, charges subsidized fees from all its students. Realizing that even the subsidized fee may not be affordable for some students, FAST arranges  need based financial assistance in the form of interest free loans . This assistance is subject to renewal each semester based on academic performance and financial need. It covers tuition fees only and is discontinued if the student's CGPA falls below 2.00 for undergraduate programs or 2.5 for graduate programs.

responses: All admitted students who are in real need of financial assistance should apply on the prescribed Financial Aid form. A notice to this effect will be posted on the notice board. The application process is generally self guided through an online system like FAST (Financial Aid for School Tuition), which helps in assessing financial need confidentially. You may need to provide tax information and other financial documents.

responses: The fee refund policy is based on how many days have passed since the start of classes. Refunds decrease as time progresses, and no refund is given after the 30th day. For example, 100% refund is typically available up to the 7th day of classes, 50% up to the 15th day, and 25% up to the 30th day. After the 30th day, no tuition fee is refunded.
